Dear Dee,

Hope you are well.

The insurer has requested feedback on the below.


From the proposal form:

*	
	Large amount of sensitive information is not configured with access restrictions and with no monitoring in place. Please provide more granular information on the protection measures currently in place.

	*	
		What protection measures are in place to secure

		*	
			Financials
		*	
			Payroll
		*	
			E-mails of CEO + Directors
		*	
			Any other protection measures in place to safeguard what Chalhoub considers sensitive data

	*	
		Are there any specific types or areas of sensitive information where we are working to improve access control and monitoring? Please outline any plans, along with estimated timelines, for strengthening access controls and monitoring for these areas.

*	
	Client accepts credit card payments but is not PCI DSS compliant?

*	
	Non-compliant with EMV standards

	*	
		Please confirm and advise points where we do not meet compliance requirements. Also, please advise if any remediation measures are planned and the respective timelines.

From the ransomware form:

*	
	What is the our target recovery time objective (RTO) for Vital Assets in case of a successful ransomware breach?
*	
	What is the current backup and restoration strategy and estimated timelines for full restoration?
*	
	Any reason for high persistent admin users? (80 persistent admin users declared)
*	
	What is the estimated number of "Domain Administrator Accounts" and "Privileged Services Accounts"? Also, please confirm if explicit instructions are given to privileged account holders to disallow surfing the internet and/or accessing personal emails.
*	
	Do we have any data loss prevention tools in place for critical systems? Please give details.
*	
	Only a small number of their vital assets are being logged to their SIEM. (We have declared that only 0-30% of vital assets are logged to SIEM tools. Please provide more granular information on vital systems that are not logged and the ones that are.)
*	
	Target time to deploy the highest priority patches has been declared at >=30 days. This is our approved internal timeline for deploying critical security patches? Or historically how much time it usually takes? Are there any plans to enforce tighter timeframes for implementing patches for critical vulnerabilities?  
*	
	What security awareness trainings are planned for 2025?
*	
	What security measure are in place for their externally exposed assets?


Appreciate your support on the above and look forward to hearing from you.

Dear Dee,

 

Hope you are well.

 

The insurer has requested feedback on the below.

 

From the proposal form:

*	Large amount of sensitive information is not configured with access restrictions and with no monitoring in place. Please provide more granular information on the protection measures currently in place.

	*	What protection measures are in place to secure

		*	Financials

		*	Payroll

		*	E-mails of CEO + Directors

		*	Any other protection measures in place to safeguard what Chalhoub considers sensitive data

*	What protection measures are in place to secure

		*	Financials

		*	Payroll

		*	E-mails of CEO + Directors

		*	Any other protection measures in place to safeguard what Chalhoub considers sensitive data

	*	Are there any specific types or areas of sensitive information where we are working to improve access control and monitoring? Please outline any plans, along with estimated timelines, for strengthening access controls and monitoring for these areas.

*	Client accepts credit card payments but is not PCI DSS compliant?

	*	Please confirm and advise points where we do not meet compliance requirements. Also, please advise if any remediation measures are planned and the respective timelines.

*	MFA is only being used for 25% users for remote access to the corporate network – Full MFA should be implemented and within a reasonable timeframe.

	*	Please advise the estimated timeline which would be needed roll out close to 100% MFA coverage for remote access, at least for UAE & KSA.

*	Client is utilising end of life software / systems with no plan to replace, upgrade this – we would need to understand where they are using their EOL software.

	*	Please clarify which systems are using EOL software and what upgrade plans we have in place. What are the EOL software related to critical systems and are there any remediation measures planned to upgrade or replace any EOL software related to critical systems?

*	Non-compliant with EMV standards

*	Please clarify which systems are using EOL software and what upgrade plans we have in place. What are the EOL software related to critical systems and are there any remediation measures planned to upgrade or replace any EOL software related to critical systems?

*	Non-compliant with EMV standards

	*	Please confirm and advise points where we do not meet compliance requirements. Also, please advise if any remediation measures are planned and the respective timelines.

*	When was the last vulnerability testing done? What were the finding? What remediation measures have been implemented or are planned with timelines?

*	When is the next penetration/vulnerability testing scheduled for?

 

Other pending questions:

*	For a UAE domiciled company why is all their data processed and stored UK / Europe? – circa 5m PII records

 

From the ransomware form:

*	What is the our target recovery time objective (RTO) for Vital Assets in case of a successful ransomware breach?

*	What is the current backup and restoration strategy and estimated timelines for full restoration?

*	Any reason for high persistent admin users? (80 persistent admin users declared)

*	What is the estimated number of "Domain Administrator Accounts" and "Privileged Services Accounts"? Also, please confirm if explicit instructions are given to privileged account holders to disallow surfing the internet and/or accessing personal emails.

*	Do we have any data loss prevention tools in place for critical systems? Please give details.

*	Do we have any data loss prevention tools in place for critical systems? Please give details.

*	Only a small number of their vital assets are being logged to their SIEM. (We have declared that only 0-30% of vital assets are logged to SIEM tools. Please provide more granular information on vital systems that are not logged and the ones that are.)

*	Target time to deploy the highest priority patches has been declared at >=30 days. This is our approved internal timeline for deploying critical security patches? Or historically how much time it usually takes? Are there any plans to enforce tighter timeframes for implementing patches for critical vulnerabilities?  

*	What security awareness trainings are planned for 2025?

*	What security measure are in place for their externally exposed assets?

 

Appreciate your support on the above and look forward to hearing from you.

 

Thank You & Best Regards,

Hagop

Subject: Additional Clarification Questions requested - Cyber Insurance

 

Dear Dee,

 

Hope you are well.

 

The insurer has requested feedback on the below.

 

From the proposal form:

*	Large amount of sensitive information is not configured with access restrictions and with no monitoring in place. Please provide more granular information on the protection measures currently in place.

*	Large amount of sensitive information is not configured with access restrictions and with no monitoring in place. Please provide more granular information on the protection measures currently in place.

	*	What protection measures are in place to secure

		*	Financials
		*	Payroll
		*	E-mails of CEO + Directors
		*	Any other protection measures in place to safeguard what Chalhoub considers sensitive data

	*	Are there any specific types or areas of sensitive information where we are working to improve access control and monitoring? Please outline any plans, along with estimated timelines, for strengthening access controls and monitoring for these areas.

*	Client accepts credit card payments but is not PCI DSS compliant?

	*	Please confirm and advise points where we do not meet compliance requirements. Also, please advise if any remediation measures are planned and the respective timelines.

*	MFA is only being used for 25% users for remote access to the corporate network – Full MFA should be implemented and within a reasonable timeframe.

	*	Please advise the estimated timeline which would be needed roll out close to 100% MFA coverage for remote access, at least for UAE & KSA.

*	Client is utilising end of life software / systems with no plan to replace, upgrade this – we would need to understand where they are using their EOL software.

From the ransomware form:

*	What is the our target recovery time objective (RTO) for Vital Assets in case of a successful ransomware breach?
*	What is the current backup and restoration strategy and estimated timelines for full restoration?
*	Any reason for high persistent admin users? (80 persistent admin users declared)
*	What is the estimated number of "Domain Administrator Accounts" and "Privileged Services Accounts"? Also, please confirm if explicit instructions are given to privileged account holders to disallow surfing the internet and/or accessing personal emails.
*	Do we have any data loss prevention tools in place for critical systems? Please give details.
*	Only a small number of their vital assets are being logged to their SIEM. (We have declared that only 0-30% of vital assets are logged to SIEM tools. Please provide more granular information on vital systems that are not logged and the ones that are.)
*	Target time to deploy the highest priority patches has been declared at >=30 days. This is our approved internal timeline for deploying critical security patches? Or historically how much time it usually takes? Are there any plans to enforce tighter timeframes for implementing patches for critical vulnerabilities?  
*	What security awareness trainings are planned for 2025?
*	What security measure are in place for their externally exposed assets?

 

Appreciate your support on the above and look forward to hearing from you.

 

Thank You & Best Regards,

Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

To: Dee Deu <dee.deu@chalhoub.com <mailto:dee.deu@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Kamran Abbasi <Kamran.Abbasi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Kamran.Abbasi@chalhoub.com> >; Joe Hobeika <Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Additional Clarification Questions requested - Cyber Insurance

 

Dear Dee,

 

Hope you are well.

 

The insurer has requested feedback on the below.

 

From the proposal form:

*	Large amount of sensitive information is not configured with access restrictions and with no monitoring in place. Please provide more granular information on the protection measures currently in place.

	*	What protection measures are in place to secure

		*	Financials
		*	Payroll
		*	E-mails of CEO + Directors
		*	Any other protection measures in place to safeguard what Chalhoub considers sensitive data

chunks.text:
*	What protection measures are in place to secure

		*	Financials
		*	Payroll
		*	E-mails of CEO + Directors
		*	Any other protection measures in place to safeguard what Chalhoub considers sensitive data

	*	Are there any specific types or areas of sensitive information where we are working to improve access control and monitoring? Please outline any plans, along with estimated timelines, for strengthening access controls and monitoring for these areas.

*	Client accepts credit card payments but is not PCI DSS compliant?

	*	Please confirm and advise points where we do not meet compliance requirements. Also, please advise if any remediation measures are planned and the respective timelines.

*	MFA is only being used for 25% users for remote access to the corporate network – Full MFA should be implemented and within a reasonable timeframe.

	*	Please advise the estimated timeline which would be needed roll out close to 100% MFA coverage for remote access, at least for UAE & KSA.

*	Client is utilising end of life software / systems with no plan to replace, upgrade this – we would need to understand where they are using their EOL software.

	*	Please clarify which systems are using EOL software and what upgrade plans we have in place. What are the EOL software related to critical systems and are there any remediation measures planned to upgrade or replace any EOL software related to critical systems?

*	Non-compliant with EMV standards

chunks.text:
From the ransomware form:

*	What is the our target recovery time objective (RTO) for Vital Assets in case of a successful ransomware breach?
*	What is the current backup and restoration strategy and estimated timelines for full restoration?
*	Any reason for high persistent admin users? (80 persistent admin users declared)
*	What is the estimated number of "Domain Administrator Accounts" and "Privileged Services Accounts"? Also, please confirm if explicit instructions are given to privileged account holders to disallow surfing the internet and/or accessing personal emails.
*	Do we have any data loss prevention tools in place for critical systems? Please give details.
*	Only a small number of their vital assets are being logged to their SIEM. (We have declared that only 0-30% of vital assets are logged to SIEM tools. Please provide more granular information on vital systems that are not logged and the ones that are.)
*	Target time to deploy the highest priority patches has been declared at >=30 days. This is our approved internal timeline for deploying critical security patches? Or historically how much time it usually takes? Are there any plans to enforce tighter timeframes for implementing patches for critical vulnerabilities?  
*	What security awareness trainings are planned for 2025?
*	What security measure are in place for their externally exposed assets?

 

Appreciate your support on the above and look forward to hearing from you.

 

Thank You & Best Regards,

Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

Subject: Additional Clarification Questions requested - Cyber Insurance

 

Dear Dee,

 

Hope you are well.

 

The insurer has requested feedback on the below.

 

From the proposal form:

*	Large amount of sensitive information is not configured with access restrictions and with no monitoring in place. Please provide more granular information on the protection measures currently in place.

	*	What protection measures are in place to secure

		*	Financials
		*	Payroll
		*	E-mails of CEO + Directors
		*	Any other protection measures in place to safeguard what Chalhoub considers sensitive data

	*	Are there any specific types or areas of sensitive information where we are working to improve access control and monitoring? Please outline any plans, along with estimated timelines, for strengthening access controls and monitoring for these areas.

*	Client accepts credit card payments but is not PCI DSS compliant?

	*	Please confirm and advise points where we do not meet compliance requirements. Also, please advise if any remediation measures are planned and the respective timelines.

*	MFA is only being used for 25% users for remote access to the corporate network – Full MFA should be implemented and within a reasonable timeframe.

	*	Please advise the estimated timeline which would be needed roll out close to 100% MFA coverage for remote access, at least for UAE & KSA.

*	Client is utilising end of life software / systems with no plan to replace, upgrade this – we would need to understand where they are using their EOL software.

	*	Please clarify which systems are using EOL software and what upgrade plans we have in place. What are the EOL software related to critical systems and are there any remediation measures planned to upgrade or replace any EOL software related to critical systems?

*	Non-compliant with EMV standards

	*	Please confirm and advise points where we do not meet compliance requirements. Also, please advise if any remediation measures are planned and the respective timelines.

*	When was the last vulnerability testing done? What were the finding? What remediation measures have been implemented or are planned with timelines?
*	When is the next penetration/vulnerability testing scheduled for?

 

Other pending questions:

*	For a UAE domiciled company why is all their data processed and stored UK / Europe? – circa 5m PII records

*	Any reason for high persistent admin users? (80 persistent admin users declared)
*	What is the estimated number of "Domain Administrator Accounts" and "Privileged Services Accounts"? Also, please confirm if explicit instructions are given to privileged account holders to disallow surfing the internet and/or accessing personal emails.
*	Do we have any data loss prevention tools in place for critical systems? Please give details.
*	Only a small number of their vital assets are being logged to their SIEM. (We have declared that only 0-30% of vital assets are logged to SIEM tools. Please provide more granular information on vital systems that are not logged and the ones that are.)
*	Target time to deploy the highest priority patches has been declared at >=30 days. This is our approved internal timeline for deploying critical security patches? Or historically how much time it usually takes? Are there any plans to enforce tighter timeframes for implementing patches for critical vulnerabilities?  
*	What security awareness trainings are planned for 2025?
*	What security measure are in place for their externally exposed assets?

 

Appreciate your support on the above and look forward to hearing from you.

 

Thank You & Best Regards,

Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

Dear All,

Hope all is well.

I’m writing to follow up on the clarification points that were previously raised. As of now, we have not yet received the necessary information. Given that we’ve set a deadline for the insurer to submit their proposals by the end of next week, it’s essential that we receive the required feedback by the end of today to ensure we stay on track.

Additional details are required on the below:

1.	
	Large amount of sensitive information is not configured with access restrictions and with no monitoring in place. Please provide more granular information on the protection measures currently in place. What protection measures are in place to secure financials?
	@Gregory Mathews <mailto:gregory.mathews@chalhoub.com>

	@Sarah Agus <mailto:Sarah.Agus@chalhoub.com> 

     Your valuable feedback would be greatly appreciated by the end of the day.
